intro: Pavetta indica f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or along stream banks. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including India and Indonesia. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural applications.
